Posts.Content: Moopy, believe me (and Joe) you really do need to rest. I will rest with you OK? I don't know why we as women always think we have so much to do and sometimes it really is hard for us to leave a few things undone and just rest. But you have my permission, and Joe's along with all of our sisters here, so take advantage dear!! there will be plenty of time to catch up (slowly) I hope you have a relaxing weekend, sleep and rest is what your body is begging for ..after all it has been through so very much in the last months. You are almost done!!! yeah!! Thanks Joe for posting , and I got your back! hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: Postponed again - oh well...

Posts.Content: Your words of encouragement were just what i needed, I also am touched by Ohilly's volunteer venture. To give back to others is a huge part of our journey, and you do this so well Susan also. I am comforted by your words. Love, Jackie
Posts.Title: Farah Fawcett

Posts.Content: I belive she is just telling her story, with alot of dignity, I admire her courage, it must not be easy with the whole world watching your demise.love Jackie
Posts.Title: Farah Fawcett

Posts.Content: I was also very depressed after watching Farrah's story. I don't think anyone who watched it would not be affected, whether they had ca or not. It is just harder for us to watch. But on the other hand it brings her own story to the media and not all of the other bad stuff that the National enquire etc. printed about it. And made others aware of the cruelty of the beast. As Re stated though..this is not our journey and we need not dwell on it. Yes its the scariest thing we will ever do. But we have come so far with new treatments..and have so many survivors to look up to. I am going to try to distract myself by doing fun things that i enjoy. I just hate that little nagging voice in the back of my mind, I hope it gets better with time. my best to you Jackie
Posts.Title: Farah Fawcett

Posts.Content: but i'm not worried about it. I love being uncomplicated and simple ( did i say simple??) what i mean is I love peace and queitness, and good vibes, I am not very tolerant of discontent, hate or enemies. when people are to serious i love shouting "NO FUN ALLOWED!! i just tell my hubby or son what movie to put on and they do it. I haven't a clue.!love you all jackie

Posts.Title: Postponed again - oh well...

Posts.Content: Do you know what the name of this pill is? Thanks Jackie
Posts.Title: cancer survivor sleep problems

Posts.Content: Hi Moopy I have never tried luenasta,,,but i have been on trazadone before and forgot how very well it helped me sleep. It is an anti-depressant, the DR. as i remember said that by getting a good nights sleep (REM) depression is lifted considerably, plus it has the anti-depressant qualities for the brain. Like a sleeping pill and anti-depressant all in one. I remember i really liked it but thought it made me to sleepy (i didn't want to sleep back then,) so i switched to celexa (just an anti-depressant) Thank you Jeanne for the reminder. I am going to ask Dr. to switch me back. Hugs Jackie
Posts.Title: cancer survivor sleep problems

Posts.Content: I think the chocolate mug cake recipe for one made me expand!!!lol Jackie
Posts.Title: CONFESSIONS OF A GOOF

Posts.Content: i could use alot of words to describe your ex, but they would be censored so i'll go along with aortus. what a low life!!! you will be so much better off without him. I would contact the ACS about this and see what they can do to help you. I am so very sorry you have to go through this. Yes you are on the right forum, please come here anytime and you will find comfort and support. Let us know how you are. God Bless, Jackie
Posts.Title: metastatic breast cancer and SURVIVING AN ABUSIVE EX-HUSHAND

Posts.Content: Yes your daughter did good...just looks professional! but how could anyone go wrong with such darling little models?
Posts.Title: OK LAST ONES FOR AWHILE I PROMISE!

Posts.Content: Thanks Pammy for sharing with us in such a interestng, charming and funny way. Start packing because I am looking forward to the sequil to this!!LOL! love ya, jackie
Posts.Title: Change on weekend plans!!

Posts.Content: Hi Nancy, My port was sore for about a week..but my first treatment they gave me a tube of lidocaine to put on the port about 45 min. before it needs to be accessed. I didn't feel a thing. I use the lidocaine every time even for blood draws. I have heard it doesn't hurt that much even if you don't use it. Now i can't imagine being without my port. I didn't get nauseated yet from treatments just tired. Your on your way girl.. Go Fight Win!!! I'm wishing you the best tomorrow and you and all my pink sisters are in my prayers tonight. God Bless Jackie
Posts.Title: Port and Chemo

Posts.Content: I love trailor trash and that tropical drink sounds sooo good. Can I come along Please? oh well guess your already gone! have fun hun! and don't do anythingI wouldn't do!! (you have a free rein LOL!) jackie
Posts.Title: I'm off..

Posts.Content: sending wishes and prayers for a speedy recovery. Hugs, Jackie
Posts.Title: Anyone heard from Kari's daughter

Posts.Content: Hold on to all of the sweet memories. God Bless, jackie
Posts.Title: Tomorrow (tonight) is a bit tough....

Posts.Content: This has to be the hardest that you will ever suffer and my heart goes out to you dear sister. My youngest son was diagnosed with an emotional disorder about a year ago.. lots of ups and downs but it would break my heart into to ever lose him. I lost a step son a month ago and although he never lived with me and was not close to me, he was also stricken with an emotional disorder...i still grieve because i knew his heart and soul.. Thank God in heaven none will live with illnesses. So sorry. your angel will always be near as you know. my prayers for you. love jackie
Posts.Title: My daughter Stephanie's lawsuit settled...

Posts.Content: Oh, I am so very sorry you and your girl have to go through all of this. You are definitely in my prayers. God will hep you get through. hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: prayers for my daughter

Posts.Content: I really like your hair. Mine looks real similar but probably alot more gray in it. I will post one as soon as i take a new one. Good job on the hair-growing! hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: GRRRRRR updating my pic

Posts.Content: Meena, I am not on here very often anymore but I love all of you dear courageous sisters in pink so much...I want you to know that you are in my thoughts and prayers...you take care of yourself hun and don't worry about missing work (wish I had more time off to do the things I enjoy) If cooking makes you happy.. cook away! :-) As cavediver say's there are so many new treatments and drugs, I thank God for that. and with us cheering you on you will come out on the other side of this. I am sending my love. Jackie
Posts.Title: Update on my reoccurence

Posts.Content: My heart goes out to you. My son was diagnosed with skitzophrenia about a year ago. He was institutionalized for period of time, and i don't believe they did him any good. I brought him home with me until he can get back on his feet. He is doing well with no symptoms on his new meds. This is hard enough on itself..I can't even imagine what you have been through. One thing i do know is that just because our children have an affliction does not mean we love them any less, maybe we love them more. It's ok to grieve as you know by now, and take your time. Let the good memories fill your heart always. I am praying for you and sending you great big Hugs. God Bless Jackie

Posts.Title: It Was A Great Conference Call Today! :)

Posts.Content: (gee you are a cutie) and that is why they want you back.. I just know it! but seriously I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers, Taleena. and wish you the best of luck. Keep us posted. Hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: Not wasting any time that

Posts.Content: I was sooo exhausted from rads and I think many are. I am still tired although not as bad, and i finished early Aug. Make sure you give yourself time to rest and drink lots of fluids. Herceptin never causes me any problems at all and I have no real knowledge of Armidex. I wish you all the best! Jackie
Posts.Title: Is it normal to be utterly exhausted from rads?

Posts.Content: just want you to know I am wishing you all the best and praying for you always. Please let us know when you find out. I have had MRSA in my hands, busitis and many other aches and pains since treatment...and the fear is always there that the beast has returned. I am always relieved when it is ANY other thing. I hope you get this problem resolved and it is nothing to worry about. Remember your sisters are always here with you cheering you on dear Pammy. xxoo Jackie

Posts.Title: Definitely NOT Dancing With Ned

Posts.Content: corney jokes always make me laugh! thanks i needed that. Love jackie
Posts.Title: Great Joke......Had to Share

Posts.Content: I will be on Herceptin for a year infusions every 3 weeks. but they say my hair will grow back and it will only be 30 min. I also will be taking some kind not sure yet of estrogen blocker for 5 years. I guess sometimes i tend to dwell on the thought..already..of reoccurance. I think this is the cause of most of my depression. Hopefully when gardening time comes and spring..i will be feeling better about things. I need to find the joy in life again. I know i can do it. I know you can too. You and Joe are taking positive steps for a long life together..I am so happy for that. hugs Jackie

The last one does not seem as bad, and maybe it's because it is the last one EVER!!! i know what you mean about family though..oh well all we need is loving support from our special few...and all of us here!! i'm so happy for you. Do you see my flashlight shining for you at the end of the tunnel? i have it on. luv, jackie
Posts.Title: 3 Taxol down, 1 to go...

Posts.Title: Anyone Else Having Trouble On The Site?

Posts.Content: please don't throw your puter out the window. I know sometimes i will write a long post and then if i go back to correct a sp. mistake it all wipes out. It is so frustrating, and sometimes when it is taking to long i hit the button again and i get 2 replies. It seems to be getting a little better lately though. hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: Anyone Else Having Trouble On The Site?

Posts.Content: I am glad you got the beads and to ring the bell.. as for your well-done-t__ts , my burns healed more quicy than I ever expected. aloe up and drink lots of fluids love, jackie
Posts.Title: Thank you from Teena ... last day of RADS!

Posts.Content: Hi Moopy and Aortus aka Lisa and Joe, Sounds like a perfect day to me!! and new shoes too!! What a coincidence..Bob was running around with the swiffer sweeping the floor and washing the rugs. even was Tootsies food Goddess! all in hopes that i would sleep in and have energy to go to my party. I am feeling pretty good. hope it lasts. You will be there with me in spirit. They may have to move it inside in the back of the American Legion if it is too cold..so far its about 50 degrees out though. I hope you have a beautiful day.. I am waiting for Tues, Moopys big day with my heart full of love, best wishes and joy that this is the end of this very hard part of the journey. Just had to charge my flashlight until then. I appreciate you both so much and your friendship means more than i can say. I love you both Jackie
Posts.Title: Moopy and Aortus are ALIVE!

Posts.Content: My son did this with me also except he is 25, and looks good in a buzz, unlike his mom.LOL! Thats way cool that the newspaper was there and your loved ones. Sounds like you have many who love you for support..You also have your supportive friends here. I know this is a really emotional thing but as i keep telling myself...it will grow back. I am glad your head feels better. Mine really hurt right before my hubby shaved it. I would love you to post us the pic from the newspaper. God Bless jackie
Posts.Title: Son supported MOM today

Posts.Content: You have come to the right place for answers and support from many courageous and supportive sisters in pink.your diagnosis i'm sure is scary when you don't have facts..the more you learn the less frightning it becomes. Keep smiling and laughing!! you will fight and you will win! God bless, Jackie
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, with tons of questions

Posts.Content: I know the waiting is so very hard. Nothing terrifies me more than more tests..and after being told horrid news once..i expect to get kicked in the teeth again by the beast. That is why like you i will do anything i can to reduce my chances of reocurance. I asked my Dr. about any clinical trials and they didn't know of any for my type of cancer. I also asked my surgeon at the last minute to take off both breast even though only my left had CA and they told me it was to late. And that we would keep a very close watch on the other breast. But i still wish i would have had a bilateral just to reduce chance of reocurance. You may need something to help you sleep as Moopy pointed out ativan and zanax is what they gave me. I only need the ativan for about the first week-10 days once in awhile. But my treatments are 3 weeks apart so i have that extra week to recoup. I will be praying for you that all tests come back good, and that you get the rest you need to fight and conquer! Hugs jackie
Posts.Title: + on Lymph Nodes => Blood Vessel => PET scan

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing your day and your photo with us. You are so beautiful, hair or none. Your little boy is such a sweet reason to fight with all your might! The article was uplifting and i could feel how much you are loved by all. Your friend Jackie
Posts.Title: Son supported MOM today

Posts.Content: I have not been on here for quite awhile, that never means you are not all in my heart always...especially you chenheart, who as someone else has mentioned are the soul of this board. I miss you all and pray for you always. I have had quite a time lately with my son who has had a couple breakdowns with his schitzophrenia and is now hospitalized. I have been so very depressed and realized I need to be here with you all for awhile...then I saw your post and the tears started pouring, I am so sorry you are going through this, I will keep you in my prayers and I know what a survivor you are. I have faith that you will make it through this too although it breaks my heart that you have to. all of my love to you. Jackie

Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: And i don't mean my family as in my hubby or my kids.. I am talking about my 3 sisters my 81 year old dad. I was the oldest and took care of them all... I was only 25 when my mom died but i was her care-giver. My Dad had to work to pay the bills ( i guess that is understandable) but i was the one taking her to each apt. and her sole care giver, i informed the family of each new problem and tried to handle it all.. driving her when my tummy wouldn't even fit behind the steering wheel, I was 9 mo.'s pregnant with my son Jase. Anyway today my youngest sister called I have heard from her shortly once since I had my diagnosis. She carried on bitching about a fight that she had with her boyfriend/father to her child.. on and on.. Blah Blah Blah!! Not a question about me.. she is burned out at her job takiing care of old people (which I do as well) and can't take another demand (Blah Blah) She feels trapped in her life.. this is when i said I feel trapped too, and something is burning on the stove! gotta go. well my family NEVER calls me and expects that i will call them, They don't even know I am going to Rads or what that means.. I am very hurt and sick and tired of holding everyone up! Isn't it time they cared for me??? well they say you can pick your nose and pick your friends but you can't pick your family!! Don't get me wrong I love them all much but.....oh well I am done trying. Anyone else experiencing this? I love you all, Jackie
Posts.Title: I am so dissapointed in my family

Posts.Content: Welcome and cngratulations! We love to celebrate good news here so..thanks for letting us in on the good news , and congratulations! Susan is right, just think of all the things you love most to do and do them with the ones you love most! Hugs, jackie

Posts.Title: Request for a VIRTUAL INTERVENTION with my wife Moopy

Posts.Content: I think Re had very good advice for you. I would listen carefully to my options. I will be praying for the best. hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: I got a question??

Posts.Content: Thank you for the update, I also have been concerned. sending love and prayers for our dear sister. God Bless, Jackie
Posts.Title: Chenheart

Posts.Content: Did not slip past me! LOL! Have fun going for your goal! You can run all over the country...and make beautiful memories everywhere, but there is no place like home. I definitely wasn't thinking that you would be leaving the boards (cuz this is home too) and am glad you have reassured us of this. We have come to love, value, and admire you both..my dear brave friends. I can't count the times you have helped me through hard times, encouraged me in difficult times, celebrated with me in good times, and laughed with me over the funny things, and I will never forget your kindness. We have been through so much together, and I am looking forward to many many more happy posts from you both. I bet it feels wonderful to be back home. I know I was so thankful to be home (and i even got to go home on weekends). Have a wonderful evening. love, jackie
Posts.Title: Home from St. Louis... at last!

Posts.Content: I know how scary it all seems right now. But truly they have come so far with treatments. I am also Her2Neu pos. and what the Dr. told me the bad news was that i had an aggressive cancer but the good news was they had a powerful new drug for that. That drug is Herceptin and i am glad i have it. As Moopy, and ourother sisters here said you will find so much loving support here with your new sisters in pink. hugs, jackie
Posts.Title: New to this

Posts.Content: Hope your doing Ok. we miss you. love, jackie
Posts.Title: phoenixrising--AKA Jan--where are you?

Posts.Content: Just wondering........i have been told by people that with each treatment you will have more side effects and try to take one day at a time but can't help but worry, can anyone help?
Posts.Title: Do Chemo treatments get worse each time?

Posts.Content: but instead I am just drooling on my computer keys! hugs Jackie
Posts.Title: Need recipe for lobster and clams

Posts.Content: Hi Darlene, I am glad you come here for inspiration. I have received so much knowledge and help from our pink sisters here. The support is amazing. Don't be afraid to ask any little (or big) question that you have. We will be right beside you helping you out until you see our flashlights shining for you at the end of the tunnel. I am wishing you the best on Monday. Let us know how your doing. Hugs to you Jackie

Posts.Content: Thank you for the update, I also have been concerned. sending love and prayers for our dear sister. God Bless, Jackie

Posts.Content: Thank you for the update, I also have been concerned. sending love and prayers for our dear sister. God Bless, Jackie
Posts.Title: Chenheart

Posts.Content: That was a perfect thought for my day and so beautifully written. God bless you. Jackie
Posts.Title: Kathi, Meena, Bj and Chen are like the captains of the football team

Posts.Content: I am so very sorry for your loss. I also watched my mom pass away from cancer when she was only 50. I also take care of many dear alzheimers patients at the hospital i work. I love them all and hope and pray someday there will be a cure for both these deceases that steal so much from us. I know there is a special place in heaven for your mom. She is wrapped tight in the arms of the angels. It seems so cruel that you have to loose your hair at this time. But there will be regrowth and a renewal of spirit as well. Keep your chin up and you will see the sun coming at the end of the storm. It is very hard to be upbeat when life is beating you up. But you don't have to be upbeat when you don't feel like it. Take time to grieve. It's ok to cry and even to be angry. Like our other sisters on this board have said, be good to yourself. That's what your mom would have wanted. That is what we want also. We all are looking out for each other here, and that support has been invaluable to me ..as it will be for you. I am saying an extra prayer for you tonight. May God surround you in His love. Jackie
Posts.Title: 2 losses in 1 week

Posts.Content: for keeping us posted. I know they told me cancer doesn't hurt but my lump hurt like a *****! That was so sweet of you Reggie to get you a new puter, what a guy!! I will be prayingfor you on the 25th, that is very easy to remember it is my oldest son's Birthday, and I have an apt. with my Onc. that day also. You will be in my heart. lotsa love and prayers. Jackie
Posts.Title: ((( CLAUDIA )))) AKA ((( CHENHEART))) Just following up..

Posts.Content: Sorry I am late responding to this post. I also tend to be a little perfectionistic and tired myself out to the Max yesterday. I have been working part-time in restorative but I foolishly thought I could work a full shift (all day running) as a CNA. I did it but when I got home I paid the price...and was also depressed because I was not back to where I used to be. I am also anemic and low on Vitamin D. What I'm trying to say is I know how you feel. It seems we will never get back to ourselves again. I toally agree with what all of our sisters have said. You are strong, intellegent, beautful, caring and have helped me so much since we found our way here to the boards. I know you will comeout of this funk even stronger and your desire for film-making will return. You have such a zest for life, and this will pass. I do agree with Judy also, The hormonal and vitamin deficiencies could be knocking usboth down. I know you will check with your Dr. for things to help this, as I will also. Maybe an injection of Vit. D to boost it right away? I am thinking of you and thanking you for being my friend always. Love, Jackie
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...
